description.narrative: UNDP will complement humanitarian assistance with support aimed at a sustainable local-level response that will also serve to make institutions and communities more resilient.
seat of a first-order administrative division
seat of a first-order administrative division

comment.narrative: An EU-standards compliant landfill for solid waste was constructed and commissioned to the Municipality of Gevgelija. The landfill is of temporary nature that will satisfy the waste disposal needs of the municipality for a period of 5-6 years until the new regional landfill is built.

An EU-standards compliant landfill for solid waste was constructed and commissioned to the Municipality of Gevgelija. The landfill is of temporary nature that will satisfy the waste disposal needs of the municipality for a period of 5-6 years until the new regional landfill is built.

1. Landfill construction procedures to be finished. 2. Workshop on positive deviance methods organized for 40 municipal and civil sector representatives from two municipalities 3. Awareness raising campaigns on recycling in 1 municipality targeting 1000 school children.

During 2017, in cooperation with Municipality of Gevgelija the procedures for setting up of the first legal mini landfill in the country were initiated and completed. In parallel, the design and the revision of the landfill solution were also finalized.
To comprehensively address the municipal resilience in the municipalities most affected by the migrant crisis, one of the soft components of the project involved strengthening of the capacities of the representatives of the local municipalities and civil sector activists to better respond to future humanitarian crisis. This involved organization of a follow up workshop on Positive Deviance, during which over 40 participants were trained on (i) how to identify and develop emergency solutions in times of crisis and (ii) how to mobilise support in the community.
The second soft component, which is also complementary to the hard component i.e. landfill construction, involved organising number of targeted awareness raising campaigns on recycling in one municipality. The awareness raising campaigns reached over 1000 school children in the municipality of Gevgelija, where the first legal landfill will be built.

1. Landfill construction procedures to be finished. 2. Workshop on positive deviance methods organized for 40 municipal and civil sector representatives from two municipalities 3. Awareness raising campaigns on recycling in 1 municipality targeting 1000 school children.

During 2017, in cooperation with Municipality of Gevgelija the procedures for setting up of the first legal mini landfill in the country were initiated and completed. In parallel, the design and the revision of the landfill solution were also finalized.
To comprehensively address the municipal resilience in the municipalities most affected by the migrant crisis, one of the soft components of the project involved strengthening of the capacities of the representatives of the local municipalities and civil sector activists to better respond to future humanitarian crisis. This involved organization of a follow up workshop on Positive Deviance, during which over 40 participants were trained on (i) how to identify and develop emergency solutions in times of crisis and (ii) how to mobilise support in the community.
The second soft component, which is also complementary to the hard component i.e. landfill construction, involved organising number of targeted awareness raising campaigns on recycling in one municipality. The awareness raising campaigns reached over 1000 school children in the municipality of Gevgelija, where the first legal landfill will be built.

Targets: - 1 landfill solution to be designed - Essential equipment to be supplied increasing waste collection capacities of at least 1 municipality - Water reservoirs to be repaired and water supply to refuges/migrants to be improved in at least 1 municipality - Awareness raising campaign to be initiated in at least 1 municipality - 60 people in at least 2 municipalities to be trained in mediation and conflict resolution - At least 5 ideas for alternative service provision to be identified. - Risk and security assessments to be mainstreamed into planning processes in at least 3 municipalities

Results: - 1 landfill solution designed - Essential equipment supplied increasing waste collection capacities of 2 municipalities - Water reservoirs repaired in 1 municipality and water supply to refuges/migrants and local population improved in 2 municipalities - Awareness raising campaign initiated in 2 municipalities - 5 ideas for alternative service provision identified and 2 being developed into specific actions - Risk and security assessments introduced and accepted by 2 municipalities.

Results: - 1 landfill solution designed - Essential equipment supplied increasing waste collection capacities of 2 municipalities - Water reservoirs repaired in 1 municipality and water supply to refuges/migrants and local population improved in 2 municipalities - Awareness raising campaign initiated in 2 municipalities - 5 ideas for alternative service provision identified and 2 being developed into specific actions - Risk and security assessments introduced and accepted by 2 municipalities.
